title.native: アイドルランドプリパラ

description:
A new PriPara web animation to accompany the smartphone game of the same name.

Note: Includes Episode 0. Episode 1 and Episode 0 were streamed in advance during the "PIA LIVE STREAM" event on August 18, 2021 and September 1, 2021 respectively.

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Virtual World
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the world inside a video game.

tags.name: Kids
tags.description: Target demographic is young children.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Demons
tags.description: Prominently features malevolent otherworldly creatures.

tags.name: Rock Music
tags.description: Centers on the musical style of rock, not to be applied to anime that use rock in its soundtrack.

tags.name: Advertisement
tags.description: Produced in order to promote the products of a certain company.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Fashion
tags.description: Centers around the fashion industry.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Chibi
tags.description: Features "super deformed" character designs with smaller, rounder proportions and a cute look.

tags.name: Chuunibyou
tags.description: Prominently features a character with "Middle School 2nd Year Syndrome", who either acts like a know-it-all adult or falsely believes they have special powers.

tags.name: Age Regression
tags.description: Prominently features a character who was returned to a younger state.

tags.name: Agender
tags.description: Prominently features agender characters.

tags.name: Rehabilitation
tags.description: Prominently features the recovery of a character who became incapable of social life or work.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Cyberpunk
tags.description: Set in a future of advanced technological and scientific achievements that have resulted in social disorder.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Transgender
tags.description: Features a character whose gender identity differs from the sex they were assigned at birth.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

name.native: 株式会社シンソフィア

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/iyaiyaenn/)

She started working as animator for [Shin-Ei Douga](https://anilist.co/studio/247/ShinEi-Animation), where she later debuted as assistant episode director on [Yakyuukyou no Uta](https://anilist.co/anime/10554//) and [Ikkyuu-san](https://anilist.co/anime/4935/) before she became storyboarder and then episode director on the [Doraemon](https://anilist.co/anime/2471/Doraemon-1979/) television series. In 1982, when another former Shin-ei director, [Fukutomi Hiroshi](https://anilist.co/staff/105280/Hiroshi-Fukutomi), established [Animaru-Ya](https://anilist.co/studio/386/Animaruya) she was one of the founding members together with Sanada Yoshinobu and [Honda Toshiyuki](https://anilist.co/staff/129528/Toshiyuki--Honda). She stayed at Animaru-Ya, which is presently known as [Ekura Animaru](https://anilist.co/studio/6257/Ekura-Animal), until 2004 before leaving to work as freelancer.

(Source: aniDB)
